items.title: How Student Survivors Are Fueling a Gun-Control Movement
items.htmlTitle: How Student Survivors Are Fueling a Gun-Control Movement
items.snippet:
4 days ago ... In the wake of the school shooting in Parkland, Fla., that left 17 people dead, 
student survivors have started a movement for greater gun control. Two students 
from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School explain how social media, 
crowdfunding and political activism have helped spread their message.

items.title: Ashcroft Looks to Step Up Efforts To Curb Illegal-Firearm Possession
items.htmlTitle: Ashcroft Looks to Step Up Efforts To Curb Illegal-Firearm Possession
items.snippet:
Jul 3, 2001 ... Attorney General John Ashcroft has said that firearm prosecutions since the 
passage of the Brady Bill in 1994 have been inadequate and has called for 
increased prosecution of gun crimes -- a drive that may have unforeseen 
consequences.

items.snippet:
Nov 25, 2013 ... 14, Mr. Lanza shot his mother to death with a .22 caliber rifle while she lay in bed. 
He later drove to Sandy Hook Elementary, where he used a Bushmaster Model 
XM15-E2S semiautomatic rifle in the assault, the report said. Mr. Lanza fired 
more than 150 rounds before killing himself with a handgun.

, which spent more than $26.8 million on ads promoting Mr. Trump.
